narrative.title: 164 Leichte Division - 1942Q4
narrative.situation: German Light Motorized Division deployed in North Africa during 1942Q4.
narrative.objectives: Light motorized division for defensive operations in desert warfare. Converted from fortress division (Kreta) to light Afrika division. Designed for mobile defense with reduced establishment compared to standard infantry division.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Coastal desert - relatively flat with occasional ridges and depressions. Hard surface with sand patches. Limited cover. Alamein line anchored on Mediterranean coast to north and Qattara Depression (impassable salt marsh) to south.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Desert warfare experience (many units from Crete garrison)

environment.terrain_type: Coastal desert - relatively flat with occasional ridges and depressions. Hard surface with sand patches. Limited cover. Alamein line anchored on Mediterranean coast to north and Qattara Depression (impassable salt marsh) to south.
